perturbation.changed_text: 6.2 Upon and subject to credit approval by Cisco, payment terms shall be 15 days from shipping date. All payments shall be made in the currency in which the Price List is quoted for the applicable Purchase Order [*****].
perturbation.explanation: This modification reduces the payment terms to 15 days. Such a short payment window may be commercially unreasonable and could violate California's prompt payment laws if it unduly burdens the distributor. The California Prompt Payment Act generally requires payments to be made within a reasonable time frame, and 15 days may not be sufficient, especially considering the complexities of international transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Prompt Payment Act and California Commercial Code
